title: 107_hr504
content: The Act titled "Community Access to Health Care Act of 2001" is for the purpose of providing access to healthcare services. The Act aims to assist communities and health care providers, especially in rural and Native American areas, in developing integrated health care systems for uninsured and underinsured individuals. This includes coordinating services, improving care quality, and building effective collaboration in the healthcare delivery infrastructure. The Act aims to assist communities and health care providers in developing integrated health care systems for uninsured and underinsured individuals. This includes coordinating services, improving care quality, and building effective collaboration in the healthcare delivery infrastructure. Additionally, it focuses on providing new Federal resources without supplanting funding for existing programs supporting low-income populations. The Community Access Program, established under the Public Health Service Act, provides grants to enhance services for the uninsured and underinsured. It aims to strengthen effectiveness, efficiency, and coordination of healthcare services. The Secretary may grant funds to develop integrated health care systems serving uninsured and underinsured communities, expanding services, and enhancing provider coordination. Eligible entities include public or nonprofit organizations like Federally qualified health centers. To be eligible for funding, entities must be public or nonprofit organizations like Federally qualified health centers or hospitals providing a substantial volume of non-emergency health services to uninsured individuals. Grant funds can be used for direct patient care and service expansions within an integrated delivery system, including outreach activities, case management improvements, and coordination of transportation to health care facilities. The grant funds can be used for various purposes such as increasing outreach activities, improving case management, coordinating transportation to health care facilities, developing provider networks, recruiting and training personnel, acquiring technology, and closing gaps in services. The grant funds can be used for various purposes such as improving provider communication, implementing shared information systems, and other activities to increase access to the uninsured. Recipients must report annually to the Secretary on progress and provide additional information as required for grant renewal.
